What was the significance of the winter solstice in early European cultures?
a) The arrival of the man called Jesus
b) The darkest days of winter
c) The end of the worst of the winter and the beginning of longer days with more sunlight
d) The time of year when most cattle were slaughtered

How did the Norse celebrate the winter solstice during Yule?
a) By bringing home large logs and setting them on fire
b) By feasting and believing that each spark from the fire represented a new pig or calf that would be born in the coming year
c) By staying inside and honoring the pagan god Odin
d) All of the above

What was the significance of December in most areas of Europe?
a) The time of year when most cattle were slaughtered
b) The time of year when most wine and beer made during the year was fermented and ready for drinking
c) The time of year when people honored the pagan god Odin
d) All of the above

What was the German belief about the pagan god Odin during the mid-winter holiday?
a) That he made nocturnal flights through the sky to observe his people and decide who would prosper or perish
b) That he was a benevolent god who brought good luck to those who honored him
c) That he was associated with the return of the sun and the end of the worst of the winter
d) That he was the god of cattle and brought prosperity to farmers

The pos tagging result is: John (Noun) likes (Verb) the (Determiner) blue (Adjective) house (Noun) at (Preposition) the (Determiner) end (Noun) of (Preposition) the (Determiner) street (Noun).
